page.title: 09THE CLOCK TOWER
page.content: The Clock Tower is considered to be the centre of the town and helps to give the town its identity. The first clock tower was built of wood and was finished in 1705. It has been used as a fire station with a horse drawn engine. The old wooded Clock Tower rotted and was replaced with a new brick-built one which was completed in 1836. Part of the funds were raised from the sale of the old bell. Bricks were donated by local benefactors. The new building had beneath it a public bath house. All of the associated buildings have now been demolished, leaving the tower surmounted by a weather vane in the shape of a mermaid.
